That's pretty serious imagery, is it not? I mean, it's pretty straight to the point. There's a man by the name of Jerry Ross, he wrote some books and ministered amongst teenagers for quite some time, and it said, I heard the story firsthand, I was not there to see it happen, but I'm told that Jerry Ross was preaching at a teen camp type of a summer camp setting, and he was preaching, he was preaching from this passage of scripture in Proverbs chapter 30. And he'd just finished up preaching and he ended with verse number 17 about the eye that mocketh at his father and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out and the young eagles shall eat it. And the story, as it was conveyed to me, after he'd completed the message and after they had a time of invitation, they dispersed to go and do various activities that they were going to do, and just within a few moments they heard some screeching cries and hollers from up the road, and one of the young people that sat in that auditorium and listened to that message that was despising and cursing their parents literally was attacked by birds just moments after preaching this message, and the birds were attacking and plucking at the face. And it was told to me personally that that took place, now that's, I think about the other couple hundred teenagers that were there, man, I'd get right in line, amen, I mean seriously. But the reality is that when we read the warnings that God gives in His Word, it shouldn't be that we have to experience something, that we have to see someone else experience something, it should be that we simply accept what God has said as being truth and saying, look, I don't want to be in that position, I don't want to have my candle be put out in obscure darkness, no, I'd rather that this commandment that was given, which is the first with promise, that I would honor my father and my mother. How do we do it practically? We must not forsake the instruction, we must walk in wisdom. I think about Holly and obviously the opportunity that she's had as my wife and mother of our children to be able to teach our children biblical instruction and provide them with truth. Don't have those consequences that we see here with the warning that is given, no, determine I'm going to obey. I'm thankful that God has given us this instruction as we think about revival this evening and revival in our homes. It's not just mom and dad that need to be walking in the Spirit and filled with the Spirit of God, it's the children too, children that need to be filled with the Spirit of God and walking in wisdom, walking in the light. So often today we have where families are turned upside down, what do I mean by that? Well the children are running the show, you see it, you see it all the time. Where the parents aren't really the parents, it's the children that are calling all the shots, the children are manipulative through their actions and their behavior and what they do and they stomp their feet and they say what they say and they're going to throw their fit until they're, well if you don't stop I'm going to do this, how many times you hear somebody say that and they never follow through? Maybe it ought not be that children are running the show, mom and dad are the responsible parties in order to raise and to bring up their children in the nurture and admonition of the Lord, but children do have a great responsibility. This evening maybe you need to thank God for your mom, maybe you need to tell her how thankful you are for her, maybe there's some areas in your life where you've not honored your mom, maybe some of the young people, I know we don't have a lot of young people here this evening but maybe there's some that God would be just speaking to you tonight and saying hey, how are you doing with this area? Take heed to the principle that God gives, take heed to the warning that God has provided, honor thy mother. Let's pray together. Father we love you, we thank you for loving us, thank you for your word, we thank you for the opportunity to be here this evening and for the opportunity to sing wonderful songs, hymns, to be challenged and comforted and Lord we thank you for your word and we thank you for this commandment with promise, the first commandment with promise and God I pray that you'd help, especially our young people this evening, Lord they would honor their parents, they would walk in wisdom and obedience Lord that they would obey, Lord that they would be used of thee, I pray that you'd help parents to fulfill their God-given responsibility. Lord I pray that we'd have homes that are honoring to thee, Lord that we'd see revival in our homes that would lead to revival in our church, that would lead to revival in our nation. I pray that you'd move and work, God if there's one that's been disobedient, disrespectful, not following the principles that you've given forth in your word, I pray tonight that they would take heed to the warning. I pray God that you'd work in their heart and draw them back to yourself, help them Lord to correct their behavior, to be aligned with the principles of your word. Well thank you for the work that you'll do, for it's in Christ's name we pray.
